description.narrative: Output 1.5: By 2021, the capacity of MOHME and other relevant partners is enhanced to promote the health and social wellbeing of children, adolescents and youth with specific focus on prevention of risky behaviors and substance use disorders., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Hiv Prevention, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: By the end of 2021, children, adolescents and mothers use improved and equitable high-impact health, nutrition and HIV/AIDS services, with a specific focus on prevention of NCD risk factors

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.5: By 2021, the capacity of MOHME and other relevant partners is enhanced to promote the health and social wellbeing of children, adolescents and youth with specific focus on prevention of risky behaviors and substance use disorders.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued its partnerships with the Ministry of Sports and Youth (MOSY) and Drug Control Headquarters (DCHQ) to develop a strategic cooperation framework on adolescent programming and adolescent drug use prevention, respectively. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:23/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of comprehensive packages utilized by Child Serving Organizations providing SUD services with specific focus on marginalized children & women,
Number of evidence based projects on prevention of SUD that are designed and pilot tested,
Existence of a pilot tested comprehensive school health package with specific focus on marginalized area,
Existence and pilot testing of an innovative community based model to reduce the social health risks to promote well-being of out of school children and adolescents (girls and boys),
